simpledc.title: Infallibility in the Newcomb Problem
simpledc.creator: Ahmed, Arif
simpledc.description: This is the author accepted manuscript. The final version is available from Springer via http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s10670-014-9625-x

It is intuitively attractive to think that it makes a difference in Newcombâ€™s problem whether or not the predictor is infallible, in the sense of being certainly actually correct. This paper argues that that view (A) is irrational and (B) manifests a well-documented cognitive illusion.
